properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 2:35AM CST until February 6 at 8:30AM CST by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
Northwestern Choctaw County in southwestern Alabama...

* Until 830 AM CST.

* At 233 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing
heavy rain across the warned area. Up to three inches of rain have
already fallen and additional storms producing heavy rain will
continue over the next 1 to 2 hours. Flash flooding is ongoing or
expected to begin shortly.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas,
highways, streets and underpasses as well as other
drainage and low lying areas.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Butler and Lisman.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 8:30 AM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
